title.rendered: Staff Spotlight: Sophie Bartley, Trainee Bookkeeper

content.rendered:
We speak to Sophie about her role as a Trainee Bookkeeper at The Accountancy Partnership.

Give an overview of the duties, functions and responsibilities of your job.

I am currently training in bookkeeping so, at the moment, I allocate bank transactions to the correct categories, upload sales invoices to match against payments, and complete the bookkeeping ready to pass over to an accountant.

What is a typical working day like for you?

I start by dealing with any emails from the previous evening before moving on to any jobs from the day before, or start bookkeeping work on a new client.

What particular challenges do you regularly encounter?

My biggest challenge now is understanding the intricate details within bookkeeping. I am learning new skills to overcome these challenges daily.

How are you able to use your skills to solve problems?

I always like to try and use the knowledge I have learnt in my previous finance rolls to work out what I need to do next before asking for help.

What is your favourite part of the job?

I love problem solving, so if something does not balance, I really enjoy working out why and fixing it.

What do you like most about working for The Accountancy Partnership?

I most enjoy the friendly atmosphere at TAP. It can be daunting starting in a new company of this scale, but everyone made me feel welcome from day one.

What skills do you find most useful to do your job?

I am a really determined person, so I think this is the most useful skill, as it means that I don’t give up when I don’t understand something. I am happy to ask for help and learn.

Where’s your favourite place to visit on days off?

I love going to the woods with my dog. I generally enjoy anything to do with nature, it keeps me calm and helps my mind relax ready for the following week.

Tell us about your proudest achievement.

I would say being at the stage I am right now. My biggest criticism at school was that I was a day dreamer. I think I was a little confused when I left school as to what direction to take. Luckily, I fell into the world of finance and discovered AAT. I couldn’t be happier to have a vision for the future in my head, finally!

How would your colleagues describe you?

I honestly think it would be multiple words. Friendly (I hope), a little bit quirky, and I probably don’t know when the conversation has ended either!

What are you reading/binge watching at the moment?

I love a good thriller, something with a big twist at the end or a serial killer documentary. I also love repeatedly watching US Office, or Gavin and Stacey.

Who do you admire, and why?

I really admire Katie Piper. I remember watching her documentary when I was younger, and her acid attack had not long happened. It really stuck in my head and I felt so sorry for her. Now she’s picked herself up and built a career helping others. I admire anyone that goes through a dark period and has the determination to make something of their lives.
 

Find out more about the services we offer by hitting the live chat button, or get an instant quote online. Interested in joining the team? Check out our recruitment page!
